project.title: Gallery
project.subtitle: A visual story of the tools, workflows, and iterations used to transform the Encino site into a digital twin.

sections.subtitle: Data Mapping & Urban Analysis
sections.description: Aura is a 3D mapping and visualization platform used in our Digital Twin workflow. It helps us layer environmental and social data to understand urban patterns and inform design decisions.

toggles.title: Data Exploration
items: Explored different map views and visualization modes.
Compared datasets using transparency and visibility controls.
Observed density patterns through gradients and clusters.

toggles.title: Insights & Outcomes
items: Identified relationships between social and environmental conditions.
Learned how layering data can reveal community patterns and impacts.
Captured screenshots and notes for future analysis and presentations.

sections.subtitle: Site Capture & Reality Data
sections.description: Polycam supported real-world documentation through 360° scans and photo references, helping validate scale, terrain features, and material cues for modeling and visualization.

toggles.title: Site Documentation
items: Captured 360° scans to document real-world conditions.
Focused on slopes, vegetation, retaining walls, and pathways.
Recorded areas missing from the contour model for reference.

toggles.title: Accuracy & Validation
items: Used scans to verify terrain and vegetation density assumptions.
Checked scale and spatial relationships against digital models.

toggles.title: Integration Workflow
items: Used scans/photos as reference for Rhino modeling.
Generated texture references to improve realism in Unreal Engine.
